answers.answer: According to some research, there can be a link between PCOS and thyroid disorders like hypthyroidism and autoimmune thyroiditis (Janssen, OE et al, High prevalence of autoimmune thyroiditis in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome, Eur J Endocrinol. 2004 Mar;150(3):363-9.)  If you have PCOS and have not done a complete hormone work up and metabolic screening for diabetes, pre-diabetes and also hyperlipidemia, you should.

question: Is there a relationship between PCOS and thyroid disorders? I'm currently having testing for a potential thyroid disorder (TSH .03 and Free T4 .03), and need to know if there's anything I need to bring to my doctor's attention.Thanks!
title: PCOS and thyroid?
